intro: Apatelantha chrysotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired flatworm, is a unique plant species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, flattened, leaf-like structures that resemble small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
